meanings.definition: To throw in various random directions.
meanings.sent1: She likes to scatter seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The wind can scatter leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to scatter nuts everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to scatter the clouds of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to scatter glitter in the air.

meanings.definition: To disperse or distribute in different directions.
meanings.sent1: Please scatter the toys around the room for the game.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to scatter into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to scatter the spices evenly across the dish.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory will scatter joy throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display will scatter colors across the night sky.

meanings.definition: A small, random amount or number of something.
meanings.sent1: He found a scatter of coins on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: There was a scatter of stars in the dark sky.
meanings.sent3: The child's room was a scatter of toys and books.
meanings.sent4: The scatter of applause filled the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The scatter of raindrops on the window created a soothing sound.
